Employment: Mother reports she works full time but is expecting to have to be off for an extended period due to hospital admission.
Father reports he very recently lost his job and is unemployed.
HousingInstability: Goal - Local Accommodations Locate long term lodging for parents during patient's admission Intervention/Plan- Local Accommodations Provided Ronald McDonald contact information and list of local hotels that provide discounted rate for CHOP families

Parents also expressed wanting to be close by due to Alayna's critical state. SW provided contact for Ronald McDonald House and explained the process of applying to stay there. SW also provided a list of hotels that provide discounted rates for CHOP families
FinancialStrain: Existing Community Services/Outside Supports: PUBLIC ASSISTANCE/SSI Public assistance/SSI comment: NJ Medicaid

Mother and father shared there have been financial stressors associated with the admission due to not being able to quickly go home for something to eat. SW offered meal vouchers to aid with the stressor of having to purchase meals while at the hospital. Grandparents report they are able to help assist with financial barriers when they can, but feel the parents would benefit from SW support when they are not present

Resource Needs Problem: LOCAL ACCOMODATIONS;ACCESS TO FOOD Goal - Access to food Assistance needed in financially accessing food while patient is admitted Intervention/Plan - Access to food Meal vouchers to be provided as deemed appropriate by SW
Transportation: Parent Stressors Financial burden of hospital admission nearly 2 hours away from home.
Parents are from NJ and report it takes them approximately 2 hours (with traffic) to go back and forth to the hospital.
